definition: member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: It turns out that you can be a committed nurse and have a social life.
sentences.chinese: 因为那可以证明你可以是个有社交生活的带罪护士。

sentences.english: Objectives To explore the training method of comprehensive competence for junior nurses in burn department.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨烧伤科新护士综合护理能力的培养方法。

sentences.english: I'm very pleased to meet you, the matron said, I'm his mother!
sentences.chinese: 很高兴认识你，护士长说，我是他的母亲。

sentences.english: A doctor was having an affair with his nurse.
sentences.chinese: 有位医生，常跟科室里的女护士鬼混。

sentences.english: A nurse cleaned and bandaged the wound.
sentences.chinese: 护士把伤口清洗包扎好。

sentences.english: Gold disappeared betweenher legs and the nurses gathered around her head.
sentences.chinese: 金医生坐在她的两腿那边，护士们则站在她的头这边。

sentences.english: Not even the patients panicked, says the nurse.
sentences.chinese: 不只是病人会感到害怕，我们也是，一名护士说。

sentences.english: Last Thursday the nurse hurt her finger and it turned black and blue.
sentences.chinese: 上周四这护士伤了他的手指，手指变得又青有紫。

sentences.english: The nurse forced the food into his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 护士强将食物塞进他嘴里。

sentences.english: The nurses denied the charges and said they had been tortured into confessing.
sentences.chinese: 而护士们否认这些控告并说她们是被屈打成招。

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate the effects of the nurse post responsibility model.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨实施“护士岗位责任制”的方法与效果。

sentences.english: The witches are deadly nurses and Banquo is assassinated by handgun and silencer.
sentences.chinese: 女巫成了致命的护士，而班柯被消音手枪刺杀。

sentences.english: I was triage nurse that day.
Take this slip to the injection room and give itto the nurse.
sentences.chinese: 把这张纸条拿去注射室交给护士。

sentences.english: eg： The nurse applied the ointment to the wound.
sentences.chinese: 护士把药膏敷到伤口上。

sentences.english: That nurse should not plead inexperience in excuse of her mistake.
sentences.chinese: 那个护士不应该借口缺乏经验来为她的错误辩解。

definition: department of gynecology and obstetrics/birth clinic
medical doctor/physician who works primarily by administering drugs, as opposed to surgeon 外科醫生|外科医生[wai4 ke1 yi1 sheng1]
